doc.after: The architecture of the Song Dynasty 960 1279 was based upon the accomplishments of its predecessors much like every subsequent dynastic period of China The hallmarks of Chinese architecture during the Song period were its towering Buddhist pagodas enormous stone and wooden bridges its lavish tombs and palatial architecture Although literary works on architecture existed beforehand during the Song Dynasty literature on architecture blossomed into maturity and held a greater professional outlook described dimensions and working materials in a concise manner and overall had a greater style of organization than previous works Architecture in Song artwork and illustrations in published books showing building diagrams also aid modern historians in understanding all the nuances of architecture originating from the Song period
